In Israel, a heated debate over accusations of genocide in Gaza slowly emerges
subhead: For most Israelis, the idea that their army could have committed genocide in Gaza remains unthinkable. But for a few intellectuals, shocked by the scale of the carnage and destruction, this characterization now seems justified.

subhead: Despite a flurry of diplomatic talks between the European powers and Tehran, Britain, France and Germany all insisted there had been no progress ahead of the vote in New York on Friday.

title: French protestors caught between anger and disillusionment
subhead: Eight days after the 'Block Everything' protest movement on September 10, the union coalition called for mobilization against 'austerity' on Thursday, September 18. More than 250 gatherings took place across France, demanding a change in political direction and greater tax justice.

title: Eleven places in France to visit during 2025 European Heritage Days
subhead: Each fall, the event opens doors to historic sites that are usually closed to the public. Le Monde picks 11 of the most compelling hidden gems in France.

title: An invitation to write the story of the photographers of occupied Paris
subhead: The 2020 discovery of amateur photos shot without authorization in German-occupied Paris and Le Monde's investigation to uncover both the photographer and his remarkable story reopened the sensitive subject of professional photographers working during the same period.

Who is Gabriel Zucman, billionaires' nightmare?
subhead: Since Sébastien Lecornu's appointment as prime minister, Gabriel Zucman's name has been everywhere in French media. The economist's proposal for a 2% wealth tax on the ultra-rich has returned to the forefront of public debate.

title: El Salvador: From 'Surf City' beaches to overflowing prisons, the two sides of the Bukele model
subhead: President Nayib Bukele has propelled El Salvador to the top of the world ranking for incarceration rates, with nearly 1.7% of the population behind bars. At the same time, the Central American state has welcomed 3.5 million tourists, far outpacing Costa Rica.

title: Who still joins unions in France?
subhead: France has one of the lowest union membership rates in Europe. Since the early 1990s, trade unions have struggled to attract new members.
